title: General Useful Reports for Admins / Manager
text: The following are useful reports that have been created for the Retail Solutions BU Report Name/Link Purpose Solution / Knowledge Base general report View KB article contributors and article usage, customer feedback etc Top Customer Analysis View customers who are getting the best and worst service etc. Note the different tabs at the bottom Agent Ticket Performance Report More explanation of column meanings on Agent Performance Report in Analytics : Freshdesk
description:
The following are useful reports that have been created for the Retail Solutions BU

Report Name/LinkPurpose
Solution / Knowledge Base general report
View KB article contributors and article usage, customer feedback etc
Top Customer Analysis
View customers who are getting the best and worst service etc. Note the different tabs at the bottom
Agent Ticket Performance Report
More explanation of column meanings on Agent Performance Report in Analytics : Freshdesk

title: General KPI Reports
text: KPIs for Support The following are the proposed KPIs for K3 Support when we have a new system KPI Definition Purpose Red Measure Amber Measure Green Measure Report Initial Response SLA Met Percentage of requests raised where the initial response time target was achieved. Measure responsiveness against contract SLAs for all cases raised except via phone. 90% Global phone acceptance rate Percentage of calls picked up within operational hours i.e. calls not missed Monitor how good we are at answering the phone (which may be a first call on an issue, or a follow-up) 95% Phone acceptance rate per country Percentage of calls picked up within operational hours i.e. calls not missed Monitor how good we are at answering the phone (which may be a first call on an issue, or a follow-up) 95% Callback Response Percentage of responses to subsequent contact from the customer via email or portal on an existing ticket which meets the initial response SLA targets Measure general responsiveness (even though not contracted) 80% Recovery SLA Met Percentage of Incidents raised where the recovery response time target was achieved For requests where there is an Incident which needs solving, how well do we do at providing a workaround, even if the permanent solution is still to be delivered 85% Resolution SLA Met Percentage of Incident and Queries raised where the resolution time target was achieved (excludes Change Requests) Where the customer needs us to fix something or help them, are we meeting our contractual obligations (contract only applies for confirmed faults, but good to measure overall service) 80% High Priority Resolution SLA Met Percentage of P1 and P2 Incidents resolved within SLA. Uses initial priority set on the case which relies on customers not overstating the Urgency and Impact of a request. Measure how well we perform for the most critical incidents 90% Resolution SLA Met Non-Faults Percentage of Incident and Queries raised where the resolution response time target was achieved and where no product fault was found. Monitor performance for where Support is in full control of achieving the SLA. 90% Average Response Time by Priority Average Recovery Time by Priority Average Resolution Time by Priority First Time Fix Rate Percentage of tickets closed on first contact (or same day might be easier to report on) Assess knowledge of FLS 40% Requests solved at FLS Percentage of Incidents and Queries raised where no product fault was found and where the request did not get passed to SLS at any point. How good are FLS at resolving items which they should reasonably be able to do 50% Requests solved by SLS Percentage of Incidents and Queries raised where no product fault was found and where the request did not get passed to another team (apart from FLS) at any point. How good are SLS at resolving items which they should reasonably be able to do 60% Portal usage What percentage of requests are coming via the portal. Driving customers to use the portal (except for System Down situations) is key for an efficient service. Initial targets low while adoption in progress. 60% Number of repeated Incidents Number of repeated Incidents, with known resolution methods (Known Issue tickbox). Identify areas of the product which need to be more user-friendly, and where more FAQs required, where portal needs refining >100 70-100 20 10-20 20 10-20 <10
description:
KPIs for Support

The following are the proposed KPIs for K3 Support when we have a new system

 

KPI

Definition

Purpose

Red Measure

Amber Measure

Green Measure

Report

Initial Response SLA Met 

Percentage of requests raised where the initial response time target was achieved.

Measure responsiveness against contract SLAs for all cases raised except via phone.

<80%

80-90%

>90%


Global phone acceptance rate

Percentage of calls picked up within operational hours i.e. calls not missed

Monitor how good we are at answering the phone (which may be a first call on an issue, or a follow-up)

<85%

85-95%

>95%


Phone acceptance rate per country

Percentage of calls picked up within operational hours i.e. calls not missed

Monitor how good we are at answering the phone (which may be a first call on an issue, or a follow-up)

<85%

85-95%

>95%


Callback Response

Percentage of responses to subsequent contact from the customer via email or portal on an existing ticket which meets the initial response SLA targets

Measure general responsiveness (even though not contracted)

<70%

70-80%

>80%


Recovery SLA Met

Percentage of Incidents raised where the recovery response time target was achieved

For requests where there is an Incident which needs solving, how well do we do at providing a workaround, even if the permanent solution is still to be delivered

<75%

75-85%

>85%


Resolution SLA Met

Percentage of Incident and Queries raised where the resolution time target was achieved (excludes Change Requests)

Where the customer needs us to fix something or help them, are we meeting our contractual obligations (contract only applies for confirmed faults, but good to measure overall service)

<70%

70-80%

>80%


High Priority Resolution SLA Met

Percentage of P1 and P2 Incidents resolved within SLA.

Uses initial priority set on the case which relies on customers not overstating the Urgency and Impact of a request.

Measure how well we perform for the most critical incidents

<80% 

80-90%

>90% 


Resolution SLA Met Non-Faults

Percentage of Incident and Queries raised where the resolution response time target was achieved and where no product fault was found.

Monitor performance for where Support is in full control of achieving the SLA.

<80% 

80-90%

>90% 


Average Response Time by Priority

 

 

 

 

 


Average Recovery Time by Priority

 

 

 

 

 


Average Resolution Time by Priority

 

 

 

 

 


First Time Fix Rate

Percentage of tickets closed on first contact (or same day might be easier to report on)

Assess knowledge of FLS

<30%

30-40%

>40%


Requests solved at FLS

Percentage of Incidents and Queries raised where no product fault was found and where the request did not get passed to SLS at any point.

How good are FLS at resolving items which they should reasonably be able to do 

<40%

40-50%

>50%


Requests solved by SLS

Percentage of Incidents and Queries raised where no product fault was found and where the request did not get passed to another team (apart from FLS) at any point.

How good are SLS at resolving items which they should reasonably be able to do

<50%

50-60%

>60%


Portal usage

What percentage of requests are coming via the portal. 

Driving customers to use the portal (except for System Down situations) is key for an efficient service. Initial targets low while adoption in progress.

<40%

40-60%

>60%


Number of repeated Incidents

Number of repeated Incidents, with known resolution methods (Known Issue tickbox).

Identify areas of the product which need to be more user-friendly, and where more FAQs required, where portal needs refining

>100 

70-100 

<70 


Incidents resolved remotely

Number of Incidents resolved remotely by the Service Desk (i.e. without carrying out onsite work)

Identify if we have hardware reliability issues

? 

? 

? 


Escalations within SLA

Annual number of escalations raised when the case was still within SLA targets. Categorised by Type (Incident, Change, Query)

Analyse if customers have unrealistic expectations and educate if so

 >20

 10-20

<10


Escalations outside of SLA

Annual number of escalations raised when the case was outside SLA targets. Categorised by Type (Incident, Change, Query)

Identify customers who are unhappy and have justification for being so

 >20

 10-20

<10

title: Report data out of sync with ticket views (link to source article)
text: See Report data out of sync with ticket view
description: See Report data out of sync with ticket view

title: Report – Sales report is missing information
text: If a sales report about which items have been sold is missing information about the item, it usually means that there is no sales price on the item. The item will then be quarantined and the sale will not be listed correctly. Either get the customer to add a sales price, or get a hold of Development and get them to change the permission to allowing no cost prize on the item.
description:
If a sales report about which items have been sold is missing information about the item, it usually means that there is no sales price on the item. The item will then be quarantined and the sale will not be listed correctly.  


Either get the customer to add a sales price, or get a hold of Development and get them to change the permission to allowing no cost prize on the item.

title: Report – single item with color, size etc.
text: Created in Backoffice under Reports and Statistics -> Stock Statistics (Udskrifter – Lagerstatistikker)
description: Created in Backoffice under Reports and Statistics -> Stock Statistics (Udskrifter – Lagerstatistikker)

title: Report – Statistics over single styles
text: Reports and statistics –> Stock Statistics Enter supplier, Department, Level, Type of Report (Summary – suppliers) and limit on Catalogue Items (add Product Code if you have it) and Order.
description:
Reports and statistics –> Stock Statistics 

  

Enter supplier, Department, Level, Type of Report (Summary – suppliers) and limit on Catalogue Items (add Product Code if you have it) and Order.

title: Summary reports
text: If the customer needs a summary report over items they have in stock/sold over a specific period of time: Summary report on suppliers/productlines, which can also be divided into catalogue items and variants. Summary report sup/prodl. only gives an overview of how many items have been sold from the supplier and divided into productlines. PDF Example: Summary report sup/prodl. divided by catalogue items shows a list of suppliers and productlines divided by catalogue items sold/in stock. PDF Example: Summary report sup/prodl. divided into catalogue items and variants shows everything (very big list). PDF Example:
description:
If the customer needs a summary report over items they have in stock/sold over a specific period of time:

 

Summary report on suppliers/productlines, which can also be divided into catalogue items and variants.

 

  1. Summary report sup/prodl.  only gives an overview of how many items have been sold from the supplier and divided into productlines.


    PDF Example:



     
  2. Summary report sup/prodl. divided by catalogue items shows a list of suppliers and productlines divided by catalogue items sold/in stock.


    PDF Example:


     
  3. Summary report sup/prodl. divided into catalogue items and variants shows everything (very big list).


    PDF Example:

title: Check if report is being generated
text: If a customers says a report is not being generated, you can go to their backoffice and press on "infocenter" This will open af new window: the first choice will show you the reports it's working on and also the queued reports. There can only be 3 reports being work on at a time.
description:
If a customers says a report is not being generated, you can go to their backoffice and press on "infocenter"


This will open af new window:


the first choice will show you the reports it's working on and also the queued reports.
There can only be 3 reports being work on at a time.

title: Turnover is with VAT/Moms-DdD BO Reports
text: Reports withdrawn from DdD backoffice for example Finance reports include information about the turnover for that specifice period. Please note that the net turnover being withdrawn in DdD is as a rule always with moms/Incl.VAT. A screenshot is shared as an example.
description:
Reports withdrawn from DdD backoffice for example Finance reports include information about the turnover for that specifice period.


Please note that the net turnover being withdrawn in DdD is as a rule always with moms/Incl.VAT.



A screenshot is shared as an example.

title: Bruttoavance-How it is calculated in BO Reports
text: Sometime,the accountants from our customers contacts us and ask how bruttoavance is calculated in DdD backoffice. The answer to this question is shared as below. Bruttoavance amount is calculated as: Net sales excl.VAT- Vareforbrug(item consumption) Bruttoavance in % is calculated as: (Bruttoavance amount)/(Net turnover excl VAT)*100 Please note that diverse items including manual product groups(goods without barcode and without any inventory control ) are not calculated in bruttoavance as we dont know vareforbrug(item consumption) on these goods.
description:
Sometime,the accountants from our customers contacts us and ask how bruttoavance is calculated in DdD backoffice.

The answer to this question is shared as below.


Bruttoavance amount is calculated as:

Net sales excl.VAT- Vareforbrug(item consumption)



Bruttoavance in % is calculated as:
(Bruttoavance amount)/(Net turnover excl VAT)*100

Please note that diverse items including manual product groups(goods without barcode and without any inventory control ) are not calculated in bruttoavance as we dont know  vareforbrug(item consumption) on these goods.

title: Item list by age – changes
text: There has often been some confusion about which kinds of transactions affect the ”age” of a client’s stock in the ”Item list by age”. The kinds of transactions in the current version of the report are: • 14, Corrections (inventory) affecting purchase • 24, Corrections (manual) affecting purchase • 30, Receipt of goods • 40, Item transfer In the new version of the report the ”datatypes” mentioned above are still the ones that affect the ”age” of a client’s stock by default. However, the report has been changed so that each group may choose which datatypes they want to affect the ”age” of their stock. The possible datatypes are the following: • 1, Opening stock • 10, Corrections (inventory) affecting cost of goods sold • 14, Corrections (inventory) affecting purchase • 20, Corrections (manual) affecting cost of goods sold • 24, Corrections (manual) affecting purchase • 30, Receipt of goods (purchase) • 40, Item transfer • 50, Sales from old systems imported into BO • 51, Sales from BO Now as before only ”positive” transactions (transactions that are adding to the stock of a given item) are affecting the ”age” of a client’s stock, no matter which datatypes are chosen. The datatypes chosen by the group (or the default if no choice has been made) are now listed at the bottom of the report (in the ”language” belonging to the group). In this example all possible datatypes were chosen to affect the ”age” of the client’s stock: Another confusion has been related to the rightmost column in the report as we have often heard something like ”We don’t even have items that old”. An asterisk (*) has been added to the column description. At the end of the report a text explains the rightmost column saying something like the following: ”Until DD/MM/YYYY” or ”Date Unknown” (in the ”language” belonging to the group). Please, create a case in the CRM if a group wants to make changes to their ”Item list by age”. Another confusion has been related to the rightmost column in the report as we have often heard something like ”We don’t even have items that old”. An asterisk (*) has been added to the column description. At the end of the report a text explains the rightmost column saying something like the following: ”Until DD/MM/YYYY” or ”Date Unknown” (in the ”language” belonging to the group). Please, create a case in the CRM if a group wants to make changes to their ”Item list by age”.
description:
There has often been some confusion about which kinds of transactions affect the ”age” of a client’s stock in the ”Item list by age”. The kinds of transactions in the current version of the report are:


• 14, Corrections (inventory) affecting purchase

• 24, Corrections (manual) affecting purchase

• 30, Receipt of goods

• 40, Item transfer


In the new version of the report the ”datatypes” mentioned above are still the ones that affect the ”age” of a client’s stock by default. However, the report has been changed so that each group may choose which datatypes they want to affect the ”age” of their stock. The possible datatypes are the following:


• 1, Opening stock

• 10, Corrections (inventory) affecting cost of goods sold

• 14, Corrections (inventory) affecting purchase

• 20, Corrections (manual) affecting cost of goods sold

• 24, Corrections (manual) affecting purchase

• 30, Receipt of goods (purchase)

• 40, Item transfer

• 50, Sales from old systems imported into BO

• 51, Sales from BO


Now as before only ”positive” transactions (transactions that are adding to the stock of a given item) are affecting the ”age” of a client’s stock, no matter which datatypes are chosen.

The datatypes chosen by the group (or the default if no choice has been made) are now listed at the bottom of the report (in the ”language” belonging to the group).


In this example all possible datatypes were chosen to affect the ”age” of the client’s stock:

Another confusion has been related to the rightmost column in the report as we have often heard something like ”We don’t even have items that old”. An asterisk (*) has been added to the column description.

At the end of the report a text explains the rightmost column saying something like the following: ”Until DD/MM/YYYY” or ”Date Unknown” (in the ”language” belonging to the group).


Please, create a case in the CRM if a group wants to make changes to their ”Item list by age”.

Another confusion has been related to the rightmost column in the report as we have often heard something like ”We don’t even have items that old”. An asterisk (*) has been added to the column description.



At the end of the report a text explains the rightmost column saying something like the following: ”Until DD/MM/YYYY” or ”Date Unknown” (in the ”language” belonging to the group).

Please, create a case in the CRM if a group wants to make changes to their ”Item list by age”.
